intro: Fimbristylis boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences of greenish or brownish flowers, which are typical of sedges. It is native to the Bonin Islands and is adapted to wetland or marshy habitats. Fimbristylis boninensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates in its native environment.
